Introduction: Oh! You... you startled me.#$b#I am Thistle. I live in the deep woods south of here.#$b#Don't worry, I won't curse you. Unless you give me a reason.
dumpster_dive: Oh... I suppose that is one way to find reagents. But please, wash your hands.
give_flowers: Oh, these are fresh. I usually dry them for potions, but... perhaps I will keep these in a vase. Thank you.
birthday_gift: You remembered my birthday? That is... very thoughtful. I usually celebrate alone.
spring_1: The valley is waking up. Can you feel the hum in the ground? It's restless today.
spring_2: I need to collect moss before the sun gets too high. It's potent right now.
spring_3: It is raining? No... just the morning dew falling heavy from the leaves.
spring_4: I saw a squirrel today carrying a shiny coin. I wonder if it was offering a trade?
spring_5: The townspeople are so loud this time of year. Cleaning, bustling. I prefer the quiet work of roots pushing through soil.
spring_6: Be careful near the old community center. The energies there are... tangled.
spring_7: I usually make a tea from nettles on Sundays. It tastes like dirt, but it keeps your eyes sharp.
spring_8: I saw the Wizard peering out of his tower. We don't speak often, but we... acknowledge each other.
spring_9: My boots are covered in mud. A good sign.
spring_10: Have you seen the cherry blossoms? They are fleeting. A reminded that beauty is a brief spell.
spring_11: I am low on sap. The trees are stingingy this year.
spring_12: Tomorrow is the Egg Festival? I suppose I will go. The town square has good energy when everyone is laughing.
spring_13: I didn't hunt for eggs. I was watching the children. Their joy is a magic of its own.
spring_14: Haley looked at my dress like it was made of old sacks. ...It IS made of old sacks, but she didn't have to be rude.
spring_15: Salmonberries are in season. They make poor potions, but excellent jam.
spring_16: I felt a shiver today. A cold wind from the north, even in spring.
spring_17: Do you believe in luck, farmer? Or do you make your own?
spring_18: I found a four-leaf clover. I fed it to a rabbit. It seemed like the right thing to do.
spring_19: My cottage smells like damp wood today. I need to air it out.
spring_20: Spring is passing too quickly. I haven't dried nearly enough petals.
spring_21: The river is running high. The water spirits are rowdy.
spring_22: I tried to buy seeds from Pierre, but he was busy counting gold. I left coins on the counter and took what I needed.
spring_23: Do you ever just sit and listen to the forest? It speaks, if you have the patience.
spring_24: The Flower Dance... I do not dance. I will stand at the back and watch.
spring_25: It is strange to see everyone paired up. I am used to standing alone.
spring_26: The air is getting warmer. Summer is breathing down our necks.
spring_27: I need to prepare my cooling salves. The heat makes me irritable.
spring_28: Goodbye, Spring. You were gentle this year.
summer_1: Ugh. The heat. It makes my dried herbs crumble too fast.
summer_2: If you see me walking slow, it's not a ritual. I'm just sweating.
summer_3: I saw a Junimo yesterday. Just a glimpse. They are shy around me.
summer_4: Jas asked me if I was a witch. I told her I was a librarian of the woods. She seemed satisfied.
summer_5: The fireflies are out. I catch them sometimes, just to borrow their light for a moment.
summer_6: Thunderstorms are excellent for charging crystals. Less good for sleeping.
summer_7: I bought an ice cream. Don't tell anyone. It ruins my mysterious image.
summer_8: The ocean air is heavy today. A storm is brewing.
summer_9: I prefer the forest canopy. The sun is too exposing.
summer_10: The Luau is tomorrow? I wonder if the Governor would appreciate a dash of newt eye in the soup... Kidding.
summer_11: The soup was... adequate. I've had better from a cauldron.
summer_12: The beach is too crowded. I found a quiet spot near the tide pools.
summer_13: Lightning struck a tree near my house. I harvested the wood. It buzzes when you touch it.
summer_14: Are you growing corn? It's a staple for many protection spells.
summer_15: I am reading a book on modern medicine. Dr. Harvey lent it to me. It is... surprisingly rigid.
summer_16: The train passed through today. It shook my shelves. I hate that thing.
summer_17: I need to visit the clinic tomorrow. Just a checkup. Even witches get colds.
summer_18: Dr. Harvey says I am healthy, though he worries about 'smoke inhalation' from my cauldron.
summer_19: The days are long. Too long. The night is when I work best.
summer_20: I made a wreath of sunflowers. It died immediately. My touch is not always gentle.
summer_21: Have you been to the desert? I hear there are skulls there that move.
summer_22: I miss the rain. The forest is thirsty.
summer_23: I saw a rare butterfly today. It was red, like warning.
summer_24: The Moonlight Jellies... now THAT is real magic. No tricks.
summer_25: I will go to the docks tonight. To see the jellies is a pilgrimage.
summer_26: They were beautiful, weren't they? A light from the deep.
summer_27: Summer is dying. I can smell the rot of leaves beginning. Finally.
summer_28: Prepare your harvest, farmer. The season turns tomorrow.
fall_1: Ah. This is my season. Can you smell the crisp air?
fall_2: The veil between worlds is thin in autumn. Watch your step.
fall_3: Pumpkins are growing. I have a special affinity for them.
fall_4: The crows are gathering. I can speak to them, a little. They complain mostly about scarecrows.
fall_5: I am drying mushrooms today. The red ones with white spots. Do NOT eat them.
fall_6: The wind whispers louder now. It tells secrets.
fall_7: I visited the graveyard. It is peaceful there. The dead are good listeners.
fall_8: Blackberries are everywhere. My hands are stained purple. It looks like I've been doing dark magic.
fall_9: The Fair is coming up. I might set up a booth... no, Mayor Lewis would ask for a permit.
fall_10: I am knitting a scarf. It is full of dropped stitches, but it is warm.
fall_11: I am not interested in the grange display. I judge quality by utility, not shininess.
fall_12: Did you win? You look pleased.
fall_13: I heard a wolf howl last night. Or maybe it was just Linus stubbing his toe.
fall_14: The leaves are falling. Every leaf is a page in the book of the year, turning.
fall_15: I am brewing a heavy tonic. For the coming cold.
fall_16: Stardew Valley Fair... Spirit's Eve... so many festivals.
fall_17: I stepped on a crunchy leaf. It was very satisfying.
fall_18: The river water is getting colder. Don't fall in.
fall_19: I need more hazelnuts. The squirrels are beating me to them.
fall_20: I feel a darkness in the mines. Have you been digging too deep?
fall_21: The days are getting shorter. Good.
fall_22: I saw a shadow guy in the town. He ran into the sewers. Strange neighbors we have.
fall_23: My birthday is coming up. I try not to make a fuss.
fall_24: The spirits are restless. They know the Eve is approaching.
fall_25: I spent the day mediating. Preparing.
fall_26: Tomorrow is Spirit's Eve. For you, a party. For me, a night of keeping the real ghosts at bay.
fall_27: Happy Spirit's Eve. And... it is my birthday. Thank you for seeing me.
fall_28: The maze was... cute. But the Golden Pumpkin is a powerful artifact. I'm surprised the Wizard lets them handle it.
winter_2: The snow muffles everything. It is a blanket for the sleeping earth.
winter_3: I cannot forage much. I rely on my stores now.
winter_4: I saw footprints outside my window. Too big to be human. Too small to be a bear.
winter_5: I am studying ancient runes today. My eyes are tired.
winter_6: The ice is beautiful, but treacherous. Like many things.
winter_7: The Festival of Ice. I am not good at fishing. The fish can sense my intent.
winter_8: Did you win the fishing contest? I was too busy trying to keep warm.
winter_9: I miss the green. Just a little.
winter_10: I brewed hot cocoa. With a pinch of chili powder. It wakes you up.
winter_11: The stars are so bright in winter. Cold and distant.
winter_12: I saw a white owl. An omen of wisdom.
winter_13: I am making gifts. Charms for protection. Simple things.
winter_14: The Night Market starts tomorrow. I love the mermaid show. Her song has real power.
winter_15: I bought a painting from the famous painter. It is... abstract.
winter_16: The submarine captain is brave. The deep ocean is worse than the deep woods.
winter_17: The magic boat is gone. The town feels empty again.
winter_18: I am running low on firewood. I will have to gather fallen branches.
winter_19: Do you like winter? It strips the world down to its bones.
winter_20: I slept until noon. The darkness makes it hard to wake.
winter_21: The solstice. The longest night. I will light a candle.
winter_22: The days will get longer now. Slowly.
winter_23: I saw Leah sketching the snow. She has a good eye.
winter_24: Feast of the Winter Star tomorrow. A time for giving.
winter_25: I received a gift. It was... unexpected. The town is kinder than I give it credit for.
winter_26: The year is ending. I feel older.
winter_27: I am cleaning my cottage. Sweeping out the old year's dust.
winter_28: Tomorrow is spring again. The cycle begins anew. Are you ready?
